name: Brown's Downtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Superb location in central down town tourist area near to public transport, shops, restaurants and tourist sites. Staff extremely friendly and helpful when we asked about transport etc. Room was advertised as small and it was, only one person at a time could pass by at the bottom of the bed; but wonderful shower and clean bathroom, big comfy bed and useful things like kitchenette with all the things you could ask for such as cups, cutlery etc. Window had small balcony and nice French style doors as the air con seemed to be set on warm. Overall pretty near excellent, coffee in free machine downstairs is awful and that is the only fault we could find.
reviews.title: Browns

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I emailed a request for some flowers for my wife's birthday, which were beautiful and were left on the bed with some towels made to look like a love heart on her birthday, which made her smile and that makes me happy.
reviews.title: good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a small room, one night, for a 55 € deal, which was a bargain in the heart of Lisbon! The room looks very good, is comfortable and clean, high quality of the bed. Feels cosy. The hi tech issue, a mac computer and ipad, makes an impression, however they are not very useful, people who need a computer always bring their own. The bathroom is rather small, but spacious enough, and the shower in marble blocks is stunning, also very functional. Few small improvements can be made: A small selection of teabags next to the water boiler would be nice. Some of the artsy bits could be replaced with more functional stuff. (For ex. the mirror is somehow hidden, yet a few paintings occupy front stage space). Overall highly recommendable.
reviews.title: cold and disappointing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Myself and my husband stayed here in november (booked in for 3 nights and left after 2!). When we arrived first and checked into our room we were impressed at the lovely decor. There is no doubt a lot of thought has gone into the overall look and design of the hotel, and a lot of money on technology (an ipad and imac in every room) which is a bit over the top in my opinion. Anyway, the room was very cold but it did have a heating system with controls on the wall. We quickly unpacked and left to go out for the day sight-seeing. When we got back in the evening we turned on the heating, we were cold and were looking forward to some heat and relaxation.(the weather was very cold in lisbon at the time)
reviews.title: Beautiful --no wi if though

reviews.text: After 2 hours the room was still freezing, so much so i could'nt take off my coat! Yes the system seemed to be on but there was little or no heat coming out of the unit. Also the unit was located up high near the ceiling in a very bad position and the air was not circulating around the room.
reviews.title: Leisure and business
Amaizing Hotel
reviews.text: Amaizing design hotel in the hart of Lisboa, easy to reach from the airport, close to the metro end to the must important touristic site of the city, you can wolk everywere, don't need to use the metro, bus or wathever. Not far from barrio alto just 10 minutes wolk from the night life clubs and bars.
The hotel is really design, new, good bed, you can chose of different king of pillow, small kitchen in room, and beautiful bathroom.
reviews.title: Feels Like Home

reviews.text: The ONLY black point is the shower, not good isolated but they confirmed to me that they are plan to change soon.
reviews.title: Great Staff and Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A special thanks to Ava and Duarte, receptionist guys really professional and perfect for good advise.
reviews.title: Great location, nice rooms, but fix the showers!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For sure is the best hotel in Lisboa and ill back soon for visit again this wanderfull fanny city.
reviews.title: Ideal base

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very chic and stylish boutique hotel in central Lisbon. Great location to visit major tourist locations including short walk to subway and trams.
reviews.title: Very Nice Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in one of the two suites on the top floor. We loved coming back to the room in the early evening prior to dinner and watching the sun set over Lisbon. The accommodations were comfortable and relaxing - exactly what we wanted.
reviews.title: Almost made it Brown's!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately we can't give Brown's a perfect rating for a couple reasons. The first being related to housekeeping. The area rug wasn't vacuumed prior to our arrival nor during our five days - and it needed to be. We actually made a joke out of whether it would be cleaned when we returned every evening. The second is that the pocket door to the bathroom didn't work properly. It appeared that the shower stall may have previously leaked and warped the wood. Finally, we had a flight change resulting in a very early departure. We arranged and prepaid for a taxi with reception the day prior to departure. As we were waiting the next morning, the over night person realized that the taxi was never reserved. The result was a bit of an unnecessary dash through the airport.
reviews.title: Nice Modern Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bottom line, I would probably stay again but would closely pay attention to recent reviews prior to booking.
reviews.title: Best location! And very stylish rooms!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Based on great reviews, we booked a room in December 2012 for a stay in April 2013. A few days before our stay, management notified us of an unforeseen problem in the hotel that resulted in them transferring our booking to a nearby 5-star hotel at the same rate we would have paid at Brown's. All went without a hitch. We were delighted of course for the upgrade, but more importantly we were highly impressed with the professional way in which Brown's handled all of this. Next trip to Lisbon (and there will be one!) we'll try again for a stay at Brown's!
reviews.title: Perfect hip hotel in Lisbon

reviews.text: Stayed at Browns Hotel in Lisbon for 5 Nights and it was good value for money. It is well situated in the walking district of Lisbon with access to all areas. The rooms were quite small but had use of an Apple Ipad and also a 26inch Apple computer which was very useful.. Property a little noisy as you can hear the walking on the floor upstairs but would stay here again if I visited Lisbon in the future.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got a very good out-of-season deal on a double room. The hotel is stylishly decorated, very clean and in a great central location, and the reception staff are friendly. Each room has a computer, ipad and (rather patchy) wifi access.
reviews.title: Good deal and great location, with a few niggles

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are a few design niggles:- the rooms are pretty small and there's very little space to store luggage (space is used instead for a kitchenette which I doubt many tourists make use of with so many cafes and restaurants nearby), the walls are very thin, and the shallow shower tray means you'll almost certainly flood your bathroom.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firstly, the hotel is in an excellent location. Near to the centre and safe area. Secondly, the staff was very helpful and friendly. Thirdly, the designs of the lobby and the room are wonderful. Lobby is like a cafe, and they serve free coffe and tea and there are computers. And lastly, there are free Apple computer and Ipad in the rooms. What else do you need in a hotel. I think this hotel deserves 5 stars, not 3. And the mirror design in the toilet of my room is really funny :)
reviews.title: Book it for a stop over.
Home away from home
reviews.text: The negative sides of the hotel is, the air con was working a bit loud, and if you take a shower, not only the bathtub, but also the bathroom gets wet.

description: Brown’s Downtown Hotel is the coolest hotel in Lisbon downtown.Staying in our hotel means to undergo singular sensations. The building dates from the XVIII century, but is completely rebuilt with contemporary lines and materials. The lobby combines pieces of well-known designers, good music and an informal reception. Trendy rooms, equipped with up-to-date technology and a functional kitchenette are offered to ease our guests’ stay.Brown’s Downtown is design. Brown’s Downtown is hi-tech.Brown’s Downtown is smiling staff.
